did you get an answer?: did you burn a CD from an ISO image you downloaded?
there is an md5sum for that ISO image ... you need to compare it to your ISO
md5sum image.iso (replace image with the name of the ISO image) will give you the md5sum of the ISO image
then if your ISO image was good, put your CD in the CD-ROM drive and in a terminal cd to the directory with the ISO image
in that directory with the CD in the drive issue "cmp /dev/sr0 image.iso"
if your CD-ROM drive is ISO
start by getting the md5sum of the ISO from wherever you downloaded it
sorry, had to help my daughter
the md5sum of your ISO image is good?
issue "ls -l /dev/cdrom" in a terminal and see what it is a link to
it will take a few minutes, maybe, but should return to a prompt with no output
if so your CD is the same as your ISO image
there are other ways to do it, but IMO this is the easiest/quickest and is reliable
